step1.sentence: She decided to build self-discipline by waking up at 5 AM every day and sticking to a structured morning routine.

step2.story: Marcus wanted to get fit but kept skipping his workouts. He realized the only way forward was to build self-discipline, so he started small by committing to just ten minutes of exercise each morning. Within a month, those ten minutes became an hour.

step3.story: After failing her third attempt at learning Spanish, Yuna sat down and honestly reflected on her habits. Every time she hit a difficult grammar concept, she gave up and reached for her phone instead. She knew that to truly succeed, she had to build self-discipline from the ground up. She began by setting a strict no-phone rule during her study sessions and tracking her daily progress in a journal. Slowly, the urge to quit faded, replaced by the quiet satisfaction of showing up even when it was hard. Six months later, she was holding her first real conversation with a native speaker.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 자기 자신을 통제하고 규칙적으로 행동하는 능력을 점진적으로 발전시키다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 목표를 달성하기 위해 유혹이나 충동을 이겨내고 꾸준히 노력하는 태도를 기르는 과정을 표현할 때 사용한다. 운동, 학습, 생활 습관 등 다양한 맥락에서 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'build'는 '무언가를 쌓아 올리다'는 의미로, 자기 규율이 하루아침에 생기는 것이 아니라 반복적인 노력으로 구축된다는 뉘앙스를 담고 있다. 'self-discipline'은 라틴어 'disciplina(가르침, 훈련)'에서 유래했다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 의지력(willpower)과 달리, 'build self-discipline'은 장기적이고 지속적인 훈련 과정을 강조한다. 어렵지만 가치 있는 일을 스스로 해나가는 긍정적이고 성숙한 태도를 내포한다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: You can build self-discipline by starting with small, consistent habits.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 작고 꾸준한 습관을 시작함으로써 자기 규율을 키울 수 있다.
